formatDescription: The Audio Interchange File Format, Compressed (AIFF-C) provides a standard for storing uncompressed or compressed sampled sounds.  The format can store monaural or multichannel sampled sounds in a range of sample rates and sample widths.  The format is extensible to handle new compression types and application-specific data.
provenanceCompoundName: The National Archives and Records Administration / The National Archives and Records Administration
formatProvenance:
Further information about this file format can be obtained at 
http://www-mmsp.ece.mcgill.ca/documents/audioformats/aiff/docs/aiff-c.9.26.91.pdf

internalSignatures.name: Audio Interchange File Format (Compressed)
internalSignatures.note: Starts like most IFF files (FORM) followed by four bytes that tell how many more bytes follow in the file followed by AIFC.
